business.headline: Sensex ends 304 points higher, Nifty above 24,600; pharma stocks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 304.32 points to 80,539.91, while the NSE Nifty50 added 131.95 points, finishing at 24,619.35. Broader market indices also ended the session in the green, as investor sentiment was lifted by favourable inflation data from both India and the US.
Inflation falls to an 8-year low, but are households feeling any relief?Inflation has fallen to an eight-year low, but are households really feeling the pinch ease in everyday expenses?
ChrysCapital takes over Theobroma bakery chain for Rs 2000 croresChrysCapital acquires majority control of Theobroma in a Rs 2,000 crore deal, with the founders retaining only a 10% minority stake.

Nithin Kamath explains how Sebi's quiet tech reform is empowering investorsBrokerage firms have to connect with several entities, like multiple stock exchanges, depositories, banks, and others. This meant hundreds of APIs and file formats had to be handled separately, creating hidden challenges behind the scenes.
SIPs, small-caps, and the Gen Z rush for high returnsGen Z investors are chasing big gains in mid- and small-cap funds, but soaring valuations and volatile markets mean the ride could get bumpy.

Tax perks, hidden costs, rental yield: What first-time homebuyers should knowStepping into the property market for the first time? Before you sign any papers, make sure you're financially prepared to handle not just the purchase price but the many hidden costs that follow. Here's a beginner's financial checklist to make your property investment a smart one.

NSDL rally hits roadblock after Q1 results, shares tumble nearly 5%. What next?After a strong IPO and initial rally, investors are reassessing NSDL's near-term growth prospects in light of mixed operational performance.
Explained: Why Paytm shares surged over 5% todayPaytm's share price rallied nearly 6% after RBI approval, lifting investor optimism amid steady business performance.

Markets open higher on easing inflation; mixed global cues keep investors cautiousThe S&P BSE Sensex initially rose over 300 points but pared some gains to trade 155.05 points higher at 80,390.64 around 9:25 am. The NSE Nifty50 was up 71.60 points to 24,559.

Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000-crore fortune without a will: Who's likely to gain most?In the weeks since Sunjay Kapur's death, the silence around succession has been broken by a chorus of competing voices: his mother Rani Kapur, his widow Priya Sachdev Kapur, his sisters, and even mentions of his former wives.
Nikkei's share average hits record-high, tops 43,000 for first timeThe Nikkei .N225 on Wednesday rose as much as 1.2 per cent in the first few minutes of trade to reach a record 43,241.27.

Lapses, irregularities, round tipping: Yes Bank's Rs 500 crore loan sale under scannerThe audit found indications that YES Bank may have indirectly financed the purchase of its own stressed asset. The transaction dates back to March 31, 2017, when the bank sold HDIL's non-performing loan, valued at over Rs 523 crore including interest, to Suraksha ARC for Rs 518 crore.

entertainment.headline: Saare Jahan Se Accha review: Taut spy tale with impactful performancesRelease Date:Wed Aug 13, 2025Saare Jahan Se Accha series review: The Netflix series explores the tense espionage between India and Pakistan in the 1960s and 70s. The series highlights the personal sacrifices behind nuclear rivalry and quiet patriotism.

Divya Khossla and Neil Nitin Mukesh's Ek Chatur Naar to release on this date. Posters outThe first-look posters of actors Divya Khossla and Neil Nitin Mukesh's film 'Ek Chatur Naar' were released on Wednesday. The thriller comedy is slated to hit the big screen in September.

Hrithik Roshan celebrates 1st teacher Rajinikanth's legacy amid War 2 vs CoolieHrithik Roshan celebrated Rajinikanth's 50 years in cinema with a special post on social media. This comes amid their films 'War 2' vas Coolie' at the box office.

KBC under fire again: A look at the show's most controversial momentsKaun Banega Crorepati is once again at the centre of controversy, this time over its Independence Day special featuring armed forces personnel. The backlash adds to a string of past moments that have sparked public debate and social media outrage.

Sushmita Sen recalls meeting Trump, says he wasn't very memorableActor Sushmita Sen opens up about overseeing Miss India Universe during Donald Trump's tenure as owner, sharing her honest thoughts on both the role and Trump.

Leonardo DiCaprio searched by cops at Ibiza party, Travis Scott denied entryOscar-winning actor Leonardo DiCaprio was briefly stopped and searched by cops at an exclusive tequila party in Ibiza. The incident highlights strict security measures at celebrity events despite star status.

Rajinikanth's fans perform rituals at Madurai temple praying for Coolie's successSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, will hit theatres on August 14. His fans performed several rituals at a temple in Madurai praying for the film's success.

Mrunal Thakur's new post amid Bipasha Basu body-shaming row: Stop staringActor Mrunal Thakur shared an Instagram post amid criticism of her comments on fellow actor Bipasha Basu. In the photos, Thakur was seen posing in an all-black outfit and matching sunglasses.

Akshay Kumar calls Twinkle's Tamma Tamma dance questionable in witty commentAkshay Kumar teased his wife, Twinkle Khanna, after she attempted to recreate Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay Dutt's 'Tamma Tamma' song went wrong.

Why Karnataka is enraged over demolition of Kannada icon Vishnuvardhan's memorialThe demolition of Kannada matinee icon Dr Vishnuvardhan's memorial in Bengaluru has sparked outrage among fans who condemned the act. Several actors, including Kichcha Sudeep and Rishab Shetty voiced their opinions on the matter, criticising the act.

With Love Meghan season 2 trailer: Meghan Markle's show to feature Jay Shetty'With Love, Meghan' is set to return on Netflix on August 26 with its second season. The trailer for the upcoming show was released on Tuesday. The second season will feature guests like television personalities Tan France, Chrissy Teigen and podcaster Jay Shetty.

Olivia Rodrigo's diamond ring fuels buzz about engagement to Louis PartridgePopstar Olivia Rodrigo was seen in Los Angeles with boyfriend Louis Partridge, wearing a diamond ring on her engagement finger, prompting speculation about a possible engagement.

Choreographer Bosco Martis on Alpha: You'll see a new Alia and SharvariBosco Martis is excited about his choreography for Yash Raj Films' action film 'Alpha'. The movie promises fresh performances and a stylish spy thriller experience.

Coolie first review: Udhayanidhi Stalin calls Rajinikanth film ultimate entertainerUdhayanidhi Stalin, Deputy Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu and former actor and producer, watched Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' ahead of its grand release. He called it an ultimate mass entertainer that will impress people of all ages.
KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan recalls treating parents to dinner with first salaryThe premiere show of KBC 17 saw Amitabh Bachchan recalling the first time he took his parents out to a restaurant.

Reinvention of Jr NTR: How the star is redefining his image for pan-India audienceJr NTR is set to make a significant impact in Bollywood with 'War 2', starring opposite Hrithik Roshan. This film is expected to elevate his status from a Telugu superstar to a pan-Indian icon, blending action and emotional depth.

War 2: Jr NTR thanks Naidu, Pawan Kalyan for price hike, extra shows in AndhraAhead of 'War 2' release, Jr NTR, in a post, expressed his gratitude to Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu and Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan for their support.

You made my life colourful: Parag Tyagi's note for Shefali on wedding anniversaryOn Tuesday, actor Parag Tyagi marked his 11th wedding anniversary with Shefali Jariwala by sharing a heartfelt note on Instagram. The couple's journey began in 2010 when they first met.

Boney Kapoor's sweet gesture for Sridevi's 27th birthday backfired. See picBoney Kapoor shared a special post on his wife Sridevi's 62nd birth anniversary. He recalled an anecdote about his sweet gesture for his late wife on her 27th birthday.

general news.headline: Sonia Gandhi's name added to voter roll before she was citizen: BJP's big chargeThe BJP's massive charge comes on the heels of Rahul Gandhi's claims of voter fraud in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls.

Will Congress apologise, BJP smirks as Bihar's Minta Devi hits out at GandhisUnion Minister Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday criticised the Congress party and Opposition MPs for allegedly mocking a Bihar woman, Minta Devi, during their protest against the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls in Bihar.

Video: Tamil Nadu student, wife of DMK leader, snubs Governor RN Ravi at convocationA student avoided Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi during convocation and received her degree from the Vice Chancellor instead. She is the wife of a DMK leader and did so to reportedly highlight the standoff between the Governor and the government.

Dear Dump Truck, My Mercedes is Already Stalling Due to EthanolThe real threat to the Mercedes called India isn't Asim Munir's rickety dump truck. It's our own engine being corroded by ethanol of all kinds. The engine needs servicing and pure petrol so that others don't zoom past us.

Rajiv Rudy triumphs in Delhi club battle that saw Amit Shah, Sonia Gandhi voteBJP leader Rajiv Pratap Rudy has maintained his 25-year-old dominance in the Constitution Club management, seeing off a challenge from his party colleague Sanjeev Balyan.

Will look into it: Chief Justice amid fury over Supreme Court's stray dog orderRecently, the Supreme Court directed civic bodies to round up all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR within eight weeks and send them to shelters. The order triggered a backlash from animal activists and NGOs.

Why BEST society polls will be first ground test of Uddhav-Raj Thackeray pactThe Shiv Sena (UBT) and Maharashtra Navnirman Sena joining forces could galvanise their core Marathi voters in and around Mumbai and pay off in the BMC polls due this year

India's 'worst civil engineers': Are broken classrooms wrecking our infrastructure?For today's ambitious students, the choice is between building an app or building a bridge. Until we make the second option as rewarding as the first, our future will remain on shaky ground

Nasa to build nuclear reactor on the Moon: Is it possible by 2030?The project aims to create a reliable energy source for future moon bases, enabling extended human habitation and supporting advanced research far from Earth.

But with the right approach, you can shed it in a way that's sustainable and lasting.

PM Modi likely to meet Trump next month in US as trade tensions simmerDuring PM Modi's likely visit to New York, plans are afoot to schedule a meeting with US President Donald Trump to iron out issues on trade amid a downturn in ties.

Salim Pistol, India's most wanted arms supplier arrested in Nepal, brought to DelhiOn the run since 2018, Salim Pistol was arrested at the India-Nepal border on August 9. He is the first person to have supplied Zigana pistols to gangsters in India.

KBC hosts officers Sofiya Qureshi, Vyomika Singh after Op Sindoor, stirs rowColonel Sofiya Qureshi and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, who were the face of Operation Sindoor and led the media briefings, will appear on a special episode of KBC. A promo of the episode has sparked a controversy. Here is why.

Tackling stray dogs is as simple as ABC. Court's impractical order misses itThe Supreme Court's August 11 order - to remove stray dogs from the streets, sterilise them and move them to shelters permanently - is neither practical nor humane.

Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's love story: From friendship band to epic romanceTravis Kelce shared insights on his natural romance with Taylor Swift amid media attention. He recalled how he gifted her a friendship bracelet with his number on it.

UP horror: Deaf-mute woman chased by bikers, gang-raped; 2 arrested after encounterA 21-year-old specially-abled woman was allegedly gang-raped in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur, police said. The survivor was caught on camera running for her life on a deserted road, with bike-borne men chasing her.

A question Congress needs to answer on sacked Karnataka ministerThe Congress is seeking answers from the Election Commission over electoral rolls. However, it has fired a Karnataka minister for asking pertinent questions on the same issue. What were the troubling questions that made the Congress remove a minister? Will Congress answer the one big question?

Kamal Haasan, Mammootty pay tribute to Rajinikanth on 50 glorious years in cinemaActors Kamal Haasan and Mammootty paid tribute to superstar Rajinikanth on the completion of his "glorious 50 years" in cinema. Apart from them, singer-composer Anirudh Ravichander and director Lokesh Kanagaraj also celebrated his golden jubilee in the film industry.

sports.headline: Wanted to leave KKR despite winning IPL 2014: Robin Uthappa's big revelationFormer KKR opener Robin Uthappa has said that he wanted to leave the team after the 2014 season to earn more at the auction table. Despite winning the Orange Cap and guiding the team to the title, the franchise refused to release him for the next auction.

Coach Gautam Gambhir believes in me more than I believe in myself: Akash DeepEngland vs India: Fast bowler Akash Deep heaped praise on Gautam Gambhir, recalling how the head coach motivated him throughout the five-Test series. Akash claimed 10 wickets in India's victory at Birmingham and impressed with the bat in their iconic win at The Oval.

Feel sorry for Khalid Jamil: Bhaichung Bhutia launches scathing attack on AIFFFormer India captain Bhaichung Bhutia has criticised the AIFF for its role in the Indian football crisis. He expressed sympathy for new coach Khalid Jamil and slammed the federation for financial irregularities.

Dewald Brevis makes rapid rise in T20I rankings after record-breaking ton vs AustraliaDewald Brevis has made rapid gains in the ICC T20I rankings after his record-breaking century in the second T20I against Australia. Brevis became the youngest South African to slam a T20I hundred.

Nation above cricket: Harbhajan slams BCCI over India-Pakistan Asia Cup clashFormer Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh feels that India should boycott playing against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2025. He believes that playing a cricket match is of very little importance when compared to the sacrifices of soldiers.

Liam Livingstone destroys Rashid Khan, spinner registers worst figures in HundredRashid Khan registered the worst-ever figures in the Hundred as he was taken to the cleaners in Match 11 vs Birmingham Phoenix. He was smacked for 26 runs in the final five balls by Liam Livingstone.

India to submit bid to host 2030 Commonwealth GamesThe Indian Olympic Association has approved India's 2030 Commonwealth Games bid, in a SGM meeting on August 13. The final date to submit documents is August 31.

SC cancels Sushil Kumar's bail in murder case, ordered to surrender within a weekThe Supreme Court of India has cancelled Sushil Kumar's bail in the Sagar Dhankar murder case and has ordered him to surrender within a week. Sushil was granted bail by the Delhi High Court in March earlier this year.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
